info.title: SCOS Sensor API
info.description:
A RESTful API for controlling a SCOS-compatible sensor.

# Errors

The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of
the API call. The body of the response will be JSON in the following format:

## 400 Bad Request (Parse Error)

```json
{
    "field_name": [
        "description of first error",
        "description of second error",
        ...
    ]
}
```

## 400 Bad Request (Protected Error)

```json
{
    "detail": "description of error",
    "protected_objects": [
        "url_to_protected_item_1",
        "url_to_protected_item_2",
        ...
    ]
}
```

## 409 Conflict (DB Integrity Error)

```json
{
    "detail": "description of error"
}
```

cert.description: Certificate based mutual TLS authentication. AUTHENTICATION must be set to 'CERT'. This is done by the client verifying the server certificate and the server verifying the client certificate. The client certificate Common Name (CN) should contain the username of a user that exists in the database. Client certificate verification is handled by NGINX. For more information, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5246.

token.description: Tokens are automatically generated for all users. You can view yours by going to your User Details view in the browsable API at `/api/v1/users/me` and looking for the `auth_token` key. New user accounts do not initially have a password and so can not log in to the browsable API. To set a password for a user (for testing purposes), an admin can do that in the Sensor Configuration Portal, but only the account's token should be stored and used for general purpose API access. Example cURL call: `curl -kLsS -H "Authorization: Token 529c30e6e04b3b546f2e073e879b75fdfa147c15" https://localhost/api/v1`. AUTHENTICATION should be set to 'TOKEN'
token.name: Token

get.description: SCOS sensor API root.

name.title: Name
name.description: [Required] The unique identifier used in URLs and filenames

action.title: Action
action.description: [Required] The name of the action to be scheduled

start.title: Start
start.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) to start, or leave blank for 'now'

stop.title: Absolute stop
stop.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) to stop, or leave blank for 'never' (not valid with relative stop)

relative_stop.title: Relative stop
relative_stop.description: Integer seconds after start to stop, or leave blank for 'never' (not valid with absolute stop)

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: Seconds between tasks, or leave blank to run once

is_active.title: Is active
is_active.description: Indicates whether the entry should be removed from the scheduler without removing it from the system

callback_url.title: Callback url
callback_url.description: If given, the scheduler will POST a `TaskResult` JSON object to this URL after each task completes

next_task_time.title: Next task time
next_task_time.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) the next task is scheduled for

next_task_id.title: Next task id
next_task_id.description: The id of the next task to be executed

created.title: Created
created.description: The date the entry was created

modified.title: Modified
modified.description: The date the entry was modified

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: The name of the user who owns the entry

task_results.title: Task results
task_results.description: The list of results related to the entry

validate_only.title: Validate only
validate_only.description: Only validate the input, do not modify the schedule

archive.title: Archive
archive.description: The link to a multi-recording archive of all available acquisitions

task_results.title: Task results
task_results.description: The link to the task results

schedule_entry.title: Schedule entry
schedule_entry.description: The related schedule entry for the result

recording_id.title: Recording id
recording_id.description: The id of the recording relative to the task

archive.title: Archive
archive.description: The url to download a SigMF archive of this acquisition

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: The SigMF metadata for the acquisition

schedule_entry.title: Schedule entry
schedule_entry.description: The url of the parent schedule entry

task_id.title: Task id
task_id.description: The id of the task relative to the result

username.title: Username
username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

is_active.title: Active
is_active.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

schedule_entries.title: Schedule entries
schedule_entries.description: The list of schedule entries owned by the user
